intro: Anthistiria forskalii, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic regions of North America and Eurasia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold climates. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it blooms during the short summer season. Anthistiria forskalii plays a role in supporting local pollinators in its harsh environment.
